stories.text: Every time I used the BK app it charges me for the food but the store never gets the order. I checked the address that it was the right store and it said purchase was approved. The store never gets the order and I have to order again at the register. It is an Android Samsung phone and my son has a newer Samsung phone and it happens to him as well. I tried reporting it to BK but they never get back. Competitor apps work just fine just not BK's app. Anyone know how to fix it or tell BK to fix it? It is frustrating that the orders do not go through. We get an order number and get charged, but no order gets through. Anyone else have this problem?
stories.title: Ask HN: Burger King's app won't send orders to BK stores, who can fix it?
The no-cost option without Gmail is available now
The conundrum with Nvidia drivers on Linux

stories.text:
I'm doing a bunch of pitches for my company and trying to improve my self-introduction part.

I'm a tech founder and I'm totally comfortable talking about the actual business, product and tech, but I feel like I struggle with the first 1-2 min. self-introduction.

I've been trying to boil it down to these three points:

- why am i doing startups - abridged work history - something light, like an interest

It feels to be this part is a shot in the dark, am I thinking too much? Is there a playbook I don't know about? Should I just focus on one thing?

I'll take any suggestions!
stories.title: Ask HN: What's a good self introduction on a VC call?
